title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (September 12, 2019).

Trump said the U.S. plans to pull most vaping products from the market, citing growing concerns about health hazards and rising use by teenagers.

The administration can deny asylum to Central Americans who cross through to the U.S., the Supreme Court said, as legal challenges to the policy continue.

Trump said the U.S. will delay by two weeks a planned increase in tariffs on some Chinese imports, a move that could ease tense relations.

The president said he is looking at five potential candidates to replace his ousted national security adviser and wished Bolton well, but slammed his policy views.

The British government described potential risks of a no-deal Brexit in a report outlining its "reasonable worst-case scenario."

Scotland's highest civil court ruled that Johnson's decision to suspend the U.K. Parliament for several weeks was unlawful.

Trump told his advisers that he doesn't plan to try to bypass Congress and lower capital-gains taxes by indexing gains to inflation.

Trudeau launched Canada's election campaign, with his Liberal Party in a dead heat with its main rival.

California legislators voted to require colleges in the state to allow athletes to earn endorsement money.

Died: T. Boone Pickens Jr., 91, oil magnate and pioneer in hostile takeovers.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

September 12, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
